items.title: OpenObserve
items.desc: OpenObserve is a simple yet sophisticated log search, infrastructure monitoring, and APM solution. It is a full-fledged observability platform that can reduce your storage costs by ~140x compared to other solutions and requires much lower resource utilization resulting in much lower cost.

items.title: Logs, Metrics, Traces
items.desc: OpenObserve is an innovative open-source observability platform designed to streamline the monitoring of logs, metrics, and traces. Thanks to its compatibility with storage services such as S3, GCS, Minio, and Azure Blob, OpenObserve significantly lowers storage costs - reducing them to about 140 times less than Elasticsearch. Our platform stands out due to its stateless nodes architecture, a feature that ensures hassle-free scaling. Its GUI is not only user-friendly but also advanced, facilitating the management of various systems and various types of observability data. Think of it as an amalgamation of Prometheus for metrics, Elasticsearch for logs, Jaeger for traces, and Grafana for dashboards, all in one place. OpenObserve eliminates the need to master a new query language by supporting SQL as its primary query language. Additionally, we support PromQL for querying metrics data, extending its versatility. One of the standout features of OpenObserve is its built-in alerting mechanism. This enables users to dispatch alerts to any platform, including but not limited to Slack and Teams. All this is wrapped in a package developed in Rust, ensuring high performance and memory safety. Join us at OpenObserve, where efficiency meets cost-effectiveness.

useCases.title: Logs, Metrics and Traces
useCases.subtitle: The only observability platform you will need. No need to mix and match multiple tools to get the job done.

items.title: Logs
items.desc: OpenObserve provides an advanced embedded GUI for fast log searching with features like top 10, search around, SQL for query, and custom VRL functions. It also has ingest and query time functions, making it suitable for beginners and advanced users to build and run sophisticated queries.

items.title: Metrics
items.desc: OpenObserve offers long-term storage for Prometheus metrics in S3 with support for SQL and PromQL. Correlating logs and traces with metrics provides a comprehensive view of infrastructure, and high cardinality data storage offers a new level of functionality.

items.title: Traces with Opentelemetry
items.desc: Distributed tracing with opentelemetry provides a means to identify performance problems within a microservice as well across in a distributed architecture with precision. Traces enables pinpointing issues that would otherwise be difficult to detect.

features.title: OpenObserve Features
features.subtitle: Explore the transformative functionalities of OpenObserve and experience a new level of data observation

items.title: SQL based query language
items.desc: Utilize what you already know. Nothing new to learn here.

items.title: Alerts
items.desc: Scheduled and real-time alerts that allow users to promptly address critical issues and dispatch alerts to multiple platforms using templates, which improves system monitoring capabilities.

items.title: Dashboards
items.desc: Dashboards provide a comprehensive view of system behavior by presenting real-time data from logs, metrics, and traces in a visually appealing and efficient manner.

items.title: Data Storage in Object Store
items.desc: Provides Storage functionality support in local Disk, s3, MinIO, GCS, Azure Blob resulting in 140x lower storage cost.

items.title: Dynamic Schema Evolution
items.desc: Ingest any and all logs without worrying about schema changes.

items.title: Security
items.desc: Fine grained role based access control (RBAC) for users and teams.

items.title: Advanced GUI
items.desc: Provides a user-friendly and intuitive graphical user interface for easier navigation and use of the platform.

items.title: User defined Ingest & Query functions
items.desc: Functions allow you to parse, redact, reduce, enrich and normalize your data at ingest and query time. Think about SSN or AWS keys redaction from logs and parsing already ingested logs to extract more information.

items.title: Localization
items.desc: Supports 10+ popular languages for the UI.
